HComboBoxButton

A HComboBoxButton object displays a labeled pop-up menu.  Used in conjuction with HComboBox.

Summary
HComboBoxButton
A HComboBoxButton object displays a labeled pop-up menu.
Instance variables
constructor
mouseDown
Shows and hides the pop-up menu of the combo box.
lostActiveStatus
Hides the pop-up menu of this combo box if the user clicked outside of it.

Instance variables

type’[HComboBoxButton]’
valueNumeric value currently set to this object.
labelThe string that is shown as the label of this object.

Extends

HButton

See also

HButton

constructor

constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)

Parameters

_rectAn HRect object that sets the position and dimensions of this control.
_parentClassThe parent view that this control is to be inserted in.
_options(optional) All other parameters.  See HComponentDefaults.

Extra options

popupMenuAn HPopupMenu
textControlAn HTextControl

mouseDown

Shows and hides the pop-up menu of the combo box.

Parameters

_xThe horizonal coordinate units (px) of the mouse cursor position.
_yThe vertical coordinate units (px) of the mouse cursor position.
_leftButtonFlag, is false when the right mouse button was pressed.  Do not rely on it

See also

HControl.mouseDown

lostActiveStatus

Hides the pop-up menu of this combo box if the user clicked outside of it.

Parameters

_newActiveControlA reference to the control that became the currently active control.  Can be null if there is no active control.
Generated by Natural Docs
constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)
HButton is a control unit that provides the user a simple way to trigger an event and responds to mouse clicks and keystrokes by calling a proper action method on its target class.
A Rect object represents a rectangle.
Define default setting here.
HPopupMenu is a control unit that represents a menu typically used in isolation, rather than as part of an extensive menu hierarchy.
HTextControl is a control unit that represents an editable input line of text.
Implement/extend the mouseDown method, if you want to do something special when the mouse button is pressed down and the component instance has focus.
